website_summaries.verdict: Quirks aside, this spreader offers reasonable capacity and build at an inexpensive price point that make it ideal for most consumers.
pros: We love how this affordable, pre-assembled walk-behind spreader holds enough fertilizer to cover 5,000 square feet – an ideal size for most gardeners' needs
Has the brand's EdgeGuard technology and easy-to-use rate-control settings
cons: Hopper unit occasionally jams, causing inconsistent distribution
Some of the plastic components feel flimsy

customer_reviews.title: works perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Ok i read the reviews and saw the only negative reviews on here were from how the wheels collect whatever your spreading.. so I read a review from one lady putting a baking tin on the wheels, I saw the pics, so I once upped her, used the cardboard that this came in, nothing but a marker, snips, and pulling the wheels off.. works perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Jon T

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: I am not usually the guy thats goes with the cheap version of tools, but this was well rated and I though maybe it would hold up.. WRONG.. I purchase this a month ago and everything was delivered fine (I know some people had issues with parts missing). Setup was easy and I was spreading fertilizer within minutes of unpacking. Then the wheels started falling off. They basically just "snap" into the frame, but they dont stay snapped. The wheels are poorly designed and make the whole thing useless.
customer_reviews.author: DR-Virginia

customer_reviews.title: A disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed with this spreader right out of the box. Arrived in a box with zero packaging material inside, so I suppose it was just bouncing all around in the box during shipping. Took it out of the box and unfolded the handle and tightened it into place. The frame is out of whack. Freely standing the 2 wheels don't even sit on the ground. The angle of the bar that keeps it standing makes it sit at an angle such that it tips backward with a feather of a touch. Spend your money on something else!
customer_reviews.author: Lin55

customer_reviews.title: Extremely flawed design and cheaply built.
customer_reviews.text: Absolute junk. Poorly designed and built. When Scotts designed this spreader, it is beyond me how they did not identify that the wheels are in the path of the spreader and then made the wheels hollow so fertilizer collects in them and then pours out directly on your lawn making strips of over fertilized/burnt grass all over your yard. Cannot believe this is what the "#1 fertilizer" company is selling, just garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looked good out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Looked good out of the box. Easy to assemble. However the controls did not work. There are 4 openings in the bin for the fertilizer. When opening them by using the handle, the 2 on the right side did not open as large as the 2 on the left. Also, the lock/unlock feature did not work at all. Poorly manufactured.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Cumley

customer_reviews.title: i knew from reviews to avoid the small cheap version ...
customer_reviews.text: i knew from reviews to avoid the small cheap version, but i used to have one of these. this one wouldnt spread grass seed, the drive wheel wouldnt turn. with weed and feed type material it worked but the bottom lever bowed and the material would continue to drop down with the lever released. perhaps the solution other than avioding it, is to load a small amount of material at a time. my yard is barely 3000', so i wasnt loading it down.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Dumas

customer_reviews.title: Great for making stripes
customer_reviews.text: I have made multiple attempts with this, but even doing lots of passes this leaves visible lines in my lawn. Of green. Apparently it doesn’t really spread the fertilizer effectively and a week or two later you will see where you went with it. The photo was my first attempt. The second time, I tried to do closer together, lower flow. Then I just got closer stripes.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Godfrey

customer_reviews.title: Poor design. A lot of flaws with the gate operation.
customer_reviews.text: Terrible design. Plastic gets caught on plastic all the time. the gate does not work properly, it stays open even after the handle released. the wheels skipping on the dirt. I just try to imagine what it would do on the icy driveway. no grip at all. The engineer who design it never tried it out. or maybe it worked on the carpeted office floor... defiantly does not work well in the field. i would not recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: RT

customer_reviews.title: Have only used it once. Worked well; however ...
customer_reviews.text: Have only used it once. Worked well; however, you MUST calibrate it BEFORE using it for the first time. BEWARE: The calibration out of the box isn't even close! You will damage your lawn if you do not follow the calibration instructions before you use the spreader.
customer_reviews.author: EandOH

customer_reviews.title: Spreads great. The only issue is the wheel issue that ...
customer_reviews.text: Spreads great. The only issue is the wheel issue that others have mentioned. The inside of the wheel collects whatever is spreading and could potentially spill more out than desired. I rinsed it out with a hose afterwards and didn't have any problems. It would be better if they just built a wheel with two sides, but overall the product does what it's supposed to. Much better than my prior spreader.
customer_reviews.author: AL24

customer_reviews.title: Great and accurate spreader!
customer_reviews.text: NIce, bigger and better than my original drop spreader. Seems to hold a lot more and has arrows in the plastic, so that all you do is line up the arrows in the green plastic with the wheel marks you just made in the grass and you don't miss or overlap - perfect results every time.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce E. Fraser

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't do the job.
customer_reviews.text: The larger Deluxe model worked fine. This Mini, however, doesn't spread evenly -- it lays down more product between the wheels and that creates a greener one-foot wide strip in the lawn. Also, its construction is not as good as that of the Deluxe. I love the EdgeGuard feature so next spring I'm throwing it away and getting a Deluxe.
customer_reviews.author: geeshaw

customer_reviews.title: Puts out fertilizer too fast
customer_reviews.text: I like that this drop spreader isn't terribly expensive since there's not much to a drop spreader. I don't rank it high, though, because it dumps out fertilizer way too fast. I made a little cardboard trough to go under it so I could adjust the rate for my fertilizer to 2 lb/1000 ft**2 to match the recommendation from a soil analysis in two passes (4 lb/1000ft**2 total). Even though I was using a mainstream fertilizer, it would simply not go that low. The lowest setting gave me right at 4 lb/1000 ft**2 so I was forced to do the yard in one pass and got a few streaks because of it. So it was workable but not optimal.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for striping your yard
customer_reviews.text: First use spreading fertilizer resulted in green lines in the yard due to material hitting and getting trapped in the wheels. Then I blocked off the inner side of the wheels with cardboard as recommended by other reviewers. With this modification the spreader still left lines in the yard due to material not clearing the wheels. I will be looking for a different spreader. Lesson-learned is to buy a spreader where the spreader plate is above the wheel line. I do not recommend using this product for uniform spreading of fertilizer or other granular products on the lawn.
customer_reviews.author: D Squared

customer_reviews.title: Broke after two usages
customer_reviews.text: After using the spreader two time, it broke. Not happy! My last spread was a Republic spreader and lasted almost 20 years. I also have only had this for about a month and can't find anyway to notify the seller other than writing this review. I would not recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Solid but expensive
customer_reviews.text: I think that my former Scott's drop spreader was something like $30-$40 (but that was in 2006ish). This one is nearly twice that. It is, however, much better built. I think that its hopper is bigger, the dial (to control the spread rate) is much easier to read, its wheels are larger, and to boot, it has a padded handle. [I broke my first spreader by kicking it in the rear to get it over a tree root with a heavy load. I basically put my boot through the back]
customer_reviews.author: R. J. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Used for Fertilizer and Snow Salt. No issues!
customer_reviews.text: Really like this broad spreader. Has a edger feature if you want to block off the right side. You will definitely go through your product quickly on the largest opening setting. So adjust accordingly. The product does get caught in the inner wheel wells and leaves a trace. Also don't pressure the release lever until you have started walking or it will dump some product in a pile on the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy! Does not apply evenly.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and seems like a good deal; that is until a few weeks later when you realize your lawn has green streaks on it. This is not application error (all walking paths and spreader setting were followed), but rather a design flaw that is well discussed for all Scott's products on the internet. The spreader shoots fertilizer into the wheels which drops some in a line more concentrated. At least I didn't kill my lawn but geeze. Just Google "green stripes Scott spreader" for more explanation.
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: Product constantly gets stuck
customer_reviews.text: I bought this planning to only use Scott’s brand product. Each of the Scotts products I have used would clog up And wouldn’t spread. You end up with a lot of product not spreading. I just used Scott’s weed and feed and it clogged up. I had to dump out the spreader and unclog the holes. By the way my spreader is clean. No issues with that. It simply allows the product to clog. I am going back to a broadcast spreader.
customer_reviews.author: Ok

customer_reviews.title: What I like most about this spreader is that it is small ...
customer_reviews.text: I followed the instructions of another consumer and added pie pan guards to both wheels - why not while I had it taken apart and had the pie pans available. What I like most about this spreader is that it is small and light. Other spreaders, when they hit a depression in the lawn stop and can deposit too much fertilizer. This unit just skips over the dents and holes in my lawn making for a quicker and more thorough job. Sometimes less heavy duty is good.
customer_reviews.author: Doris

customer_reviews.title: Weak drive.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to handle fertilizer OK, but grass seed is too much of a load. They use a weak aluminum pin which sheers under this load. I replaced it with a cotton pin about the size used in front wheel bearing of older cars. Also the wheels are a slick plastic which doesn't have much traction, & can slip which results in uneven applications. I bought it because of the double spreaders wheels, but apparently that is too much load for the build quality. I doubt if I'll ever buy another Scott product again unless they show good faith by recall this spreader & fixing the problems with the pin drive, & wheels.
customer_reviews.author: Class Buddy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome {Even Rock Salt}
customer_reviews.text: I bought this spreader in July, and it did what I asked it to do with no issues at all. Now its January and I have used it twice now with Rock Salt {the same they use for the Roads} for my Driveway. I was very hesitant with the Salt part, so I tested it out with just a little, It did great. Then I filled the hopper 1/2 way, with the chute open 3/4 mind you and it has worked flawlessly so far. Even if it broke right now it has paid for itself and then some. I would definetly purchase another one.
customer_reviews.author: southshore74

customer_reviews.title: Don't Waste Your Money - pay a little more for the one you'll have to buy anyway
customer_reviews.text: I will be buying another spreader after using this one twice. I have about 10,000ft^2 to cover and thought any spreader would do with a little patience. I was wrong. The spreader trigger is actually a little tough on the hand so I ended up just using a clamp to leave it open all the time. The broadcast range is incredibly narrow: so much so that I have streaking in my yard from where I pushed the spreader. Its obviously cheap. Just about every single piece is plastic and I would fully expect it to break within a few years of use. Unless you live on a postage stamp sized lot, this is not for you.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew C

customer_reviews.title: Who assembled this thing??
customer_reviews.text: This was assembled when I received it. Whoever assembled it apparently thought assembly instructions were not necessary. The stand wire (so it will sit upright) is on the front!!! It goes on the back!! I have a muscle disorder which causes a grip problem. I had to get this thing upside down and take it apart and fix it. Even this old woman knows the wire goes on the back. WIth it on the front, you can't roll it across the grass so it doesn't spread. Ease of use? Impossible. Easy to assemble? Someone didn't think so.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Powell

customer_reviews.title: ... past and they were more of a pain than good. So I am happy that this one is ...
customer_reviews.text: Have had spreaders in the past and they were more of a pain than good. So I am happy that this one is holding up and works well all the time.
customer_reviews.author: VTSnoop

customer_reviews.title: Beware, do not buy
customer_reviews.text: LOOK AT HOW BADLY THIS DUMPS OUT. WE ARE OUTSIDE WITH A VACUUM TO MAKE SURE OUR LAWN DOESN'T DIE. I am seriously astounded. It's like I took a cup and dumped it out. At best, this makes really bad stripes. At worst, it will burn your lawn with spots.
customer_reviews.author: S. SOARES

customer_reviews.title: Poor design leads to stripes
customer_reviews.text: This spreader, doesn't spread. After a full season of using the product my yard now looks like a grid where this just drops the product as you walk. Buy any other product if you want a quality lawn.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Fully Assembled, Works Great Out of the Box. Great Support from Scotts.
customer_reviews.text: Unfolded the handle, dumped in 40 pounds of pelletized lime, spreader worked like a charm. Getting one at half price through a warehouse deal also a plus. I actually prefer the mostly plastic construction, as it’s easier to just hose off and hang on the wall, fairly light, and no worries about rust. Although not listed, Scott’s guarantees this spreader for as long as you own it. Check their website for details. Update: one wheel had a small missing piece in the tread, probably from being bounced during shipping. I emailed Scotts and received a reply the next day letting me know they were shipping out a replacement wheel. Very pleased with the quick response.
customer_reviews.author: Timazon

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Missing wingnut on the handle. Tried to get it replaced via chat and two different people couldn’t figure out how to do a return. First guy went on a break leaving me hanging then someone else showed up and didn’t even know what I was there for. Never use chat support, it’s a joke. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy
customer_reviews.text: I received this drop spreader today before noon. Placed some Scott grass seed in the hopper. Wheels would bind constantly. Had to pull it back and then push forward only to repeat the process again and again. After only approx. 200 sq. ft., I packed it back in the box and contacted Amazon. Thanks for amazon. Too bad they have to eat the costs for junk like this.
customer_reviews.author: vitamix

customer_reviews.title: Create stripes on my lawn... flaw bad design
customer_reviews.text: My Scott mini spreader create stripes on my lawn. My neighbors also have the same problem with this mini spreader. 2 flaw designs in the spreader: 1. Spreader spin height that should be higher than the wheel. 2. The cheap wheel caught fertilizer in the wheel. These flaws create stripe pattern .. look very ugly in the lawn. I'm going to trash this spreader and going with a different brand that don't have these problems.
customer_reviews.author: Si Dinh

customer_reviews.title: I needed to spread my remaining fertilizer from 2 moves ...
customer_reviews.text: I needed to spread my remaining fertilizer from 2 moves and I was not going to use our hand spreader for our large yard. When I got this there were no instructions of pamphlets which caused an issue when I tried to figure out what setting to use for my product. After some goggling I put in on 4 and started walking. If there were some included directions on what the setting numbers meant that would have saved some time on getting my yard finished. I didn't have the issue of fertilizer collecting in the wheels (maybe since the setting was low).
customer_reviews.author: Reggie_0384

customer_reviews.title: Found the issue here.
customer_reviews.text: Okay. Read the reviews. Good and bad. I know what the issue is here. The thrower is driven off of the wheel turning. But the unit does not have enough weight to keep the down pressure required to maintain traction and turn the wheel. The result is it dumps the contents in a straight line. Could be fixed but honestly its a design flaw that should be corrected
customer_reviews.author: Doc

customer_reviews.title: Poor design for an universal tool
customer_reviews.text: Poor basic design. Spreader spinner has been clogged and make the wheel rotating it blocked. Terrible idea. Very limited.
customer_reviews.author: JCJ

customer_reviews.title: Scotts owes me stars...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product on Amazon early in 2018, and I used it one and a half times to fertilize an acre of grass. I can report that despite being stored clean and empty between uses in a climate controlled garage, it worked as advertised precisely one time, and then broke and will not spread fertilizer at all half way through the second use. Scotts fertilizer products are great, but until they fix their quality control issues, I highly recommend avoiding this brand's spreaders. This is not the first product of theirs that failed for me on or shortly after the first use.
customer_reviews.author: KTurner

customer_reviews.title: Very good basic.
customer_reviews.text: The next one I get, will be used by my robot, and this is not suited to robot use. But good enough for you. I don't own the robot yet, I keep nagging the kids in middle school to make me one, because adults are never going to understand how to do it right. These spreaders do not last that long because the fertilizer is so corrosive on metal, steel. They reduced the metal on this model from the previous, where the wheels fell off rusted through. The next one for the robot should be entirely with plastic or high quality stainless. Mean while rinse it well after every use. Note the grass likes the spread.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Better than the previous Scotts Drop Spreader
customer_reviews.text: This is a great spreader. Its much larger than the previous Scotts Drop Spreader that I had and due to the increased size I was able to reduce the amount of time in the yard by a fair amount. Well worth the price. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Nothing Elite About It
customer_reviews.text: I have been very pleased with my Scott’s Edge Guard Mini, but I wanted something with more capacity, so I bought this Scott’s Elite Spreader. But let me tell you, there is nothing “ELITE” about it: • Dumps tons and tons of product on the ground when switching from edge guard mode to standard • Agitator inside does a poor job of getting product down through the holes when there is only a little bit left • Does not spread 6 feet as they claim it does Just very disappointed in the performance of this spreader, especially after paying approximately $107 for it.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk Downing

customer_reviews.title: You would think this was a knock off brand
customer_reviews.text: I have now tried out two of these with both breaking after use. I live on an acre and about 16,000 sq. ft of it is grass so this was the perfect size. After covering about 10,000 sq. ft, the black plate that spreads the fertilizer broke off the plastic shaft that rotates it. I noticed that the plastic tubing was very hot. The first one I had bought had something wrong with the gear which didn't allow the wheel to spin properly.
customer_reviews.author: G C

customer_reviews.title: I resisted a broadcast spreader
customer_reviews.text: I always used a drop spreader because, in my mind, I could better control the application area of a pass with a drop spreader. In reality, though, Scotts drop spreaders of today are not the quality of the metal ones i used as a youngster. They wear out, and change their effective application rate over time. I decided to get this broadcast spreader and after using it twice, I discovered that pass control is quite easy to figure out, and fertilizing my 1/3-acre property can be done in half the time. It also seems that the mechanism of the broadcast spreader would not 'change with wear over time', although that still needs to be determined.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hochreiter

customer_reviews.title: Great product and customer service
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice spreader to quickly cover large lawns. I also own a Scotts classic drop spreader for smaller areas. One day while applying lime, the wheels stopped rotating the rotors. I contacted Scotts and they sent me free replacement parts. It took about 15 minutes to replace the broken part and my Elite spreader is as good as new. Thanks Scotts for the awesome customer service.
customer_reviews.author: RichS

customer_reviews.title: Makes the Job Easier
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased and so is my gardener. He was operating with a handheld one that I don't think fully took care of my lawn properly giving the amount of fertilizer I needed on it. My yard is not small. So, I purchased this myself to make sure that I am getting the service that I need and want. This made the job go so much faster for him because it holds so much fertilizer. He did not look stress or near a heatstroke after completing the job. He needs one but I am keep this for myself. I would have no problem doing the job myself with this product. Too easy!
customer_reviews.author: Mitchie

customer_reviews.title: Uneven Application
customer_reviews.text: Seem solidly built and the edge guard is nice. But like other reviewers experienced, it doesn’t spread the fertilizer evenly. I have light and dark green zebra stripes on my lawn. This happened without the edge guard engaged. This uses two side by side rotating discs to spread the fertilizer. I think the spray from the two discs overlap in the center, distributing more material near the center than off to the left and right. I’ll keep using my old spreader. It’s not as nice and has no edge guard. But I’ve never had trouble with uneven application.
customer_reviews.author: John Butler

customer_reviews.title: My retired dad loves it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought for my mid-60s dad. The stepped up version features dual wheels and is well-balanced and easy to maneuver around turns. His yard has many twists around flower beds and the adjustable spread settings worked well. It was also easy for him to assemble without any help. No complaints. He was very happy with it. Thanks Scotts!
customer_reviews.author: Luke Skywalker

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a Vigoro broadcast spreader. I'll never use a broadcast spreader again.... This thing is great for my needs and even though I do have to walk a lot more with it, the coverage is somewhere around a bazillion times better and twenty-bazillion times more consistent. With no mess all over the hardscape as a bonus. If the wheels weren't hard plastic, I'd keep it handy in the winter for ice-melt on the drive and walk.
customer_reviews.author: Xylob

customer_reviews.title: Quality and decent price
customer_reviews.text: I like this spreader for its quality feel and spread of product on my lawn. I have one issue with the position of the lock open switch, as I have accidentally hit it, and not known about it. This allows the trap to be open and allows product to spill out, then spread in heaps on the lawn. It happened twice in one day. Maybe it is all my fault, but I think the design could be better placed where the user can not bump up against the switch. I hope this spreader lasts more than 8 years of use of only 4-5 times per year. We will see.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality Spreader
customer_reviews.text: This is a top quality product. Yes, you can get a spreader for less money, but it won't be of this quality. It's very well balanced and easy to push. Also, it's easy to fill. Clean up is also a breeze. I know I'll get years of service from this. Since I use mostly Scott's products on my lawn I wanted a Scott's spreader so there wouldn't be a problem in figuring out application amounts. I would highly recommend this spreader.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lemon
customer_reviews.text: Poor made product. Wheels jammed the very first time I used it. Unable to move t around the lawn. Product too large to return as I got rid of the box etc. Lesson learned, purchase small online.
customer_reviews.author: Giles B.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap construction
customer_reviews.text: I am finally giving up on this spreader. It has less than 3 hours of use but I have spent more time trying to keep it working than actually spreading fertilizer. The materials used in this poorly designed spreader are cheap. There is a little pin in the axle that turns the spreaders, This broke with a couple of uses. I had to disassemble the axle in order fashion a new pin out of a nail. The dual doors won't open and shut consistently so you'll have to fiddle continually with the setting dial. Thinking about buying this spreader? Keep the owner's manual... you're going to need it.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Missing handle
customer_reviews.text: EDIT: The second part of the handle was very hidden on the original product and we didn’t find it until we tried to put on the new handle from the company. I had looked everywhere for it, there was no indication or direction on where it was located. We finally called Scott’s after sending some emails and they sent a new handle that came within a few weeks, which we no longer need. Original review: Got the product without the handle. Have contacted Scott’s via email 2 times. I’m sure it works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: alb2

customer_reviews.title: Best spreader I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I've literally never owned a spreader I liked - until now. This thing works really well. I was nervous at first because there are a lot of plastic parts, but it has held up well. No complaints!
customer_reviews.author: Joe Pike

customer_reviews.title: Okay spreader with some problems
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to put together, and it does work, but with some drawbacks. The wheel mechanism turns the roter and does the spreading action, however you need some friction to turn the wheel, and the thing is so light that that doesn't happen all the time. So that leads to some inconsistent spots. Also, it leaves a line thick with material which I thought was disapointing, had to walk around and help it out a bit with a rake Overall it was fine, but could have been better.
customer_reviews.author: Shannen

customer_reviews.title: Broke immediately. First load of seed. Maybe 3 lbs of seed.
customer_reviews.text: Junk. Never finished my normal sized front yard and it was broken. Spinner inside drum was broken off. I used my hand to toss seeds at $125 per 25 lb bag. Don’t even consider buying this product.
customer_reviews.author: James Horvath

customer_reviews.title: Easy to over do it
customer_reviews.text: I've used a hand spreader for years without issue, but the second time I used this thing on my lawn, I had the setting set right as per the instructions on the bag of Scotts I was using on my lawn, a week later I noticed two big brown dead spots on the lawn where too much fertilizer got dumped and were now just scorched earth where my thick healthy lawn used to grow. If it were an animal wrecking the lawn then I'd have more deadspots but it's just the two from that one time the spreader dumped too much somehow.
customer_reviews.author: Luke M

customer_reviews.title: Jury out.  Jams with 7lbs of seed.
customer_reviews.text: Got it in. Put together. did static calibration. Went to spread 7lbs (~2.8KG) bag of grass seed. Wouldn't turn the auger on a 16 setting. The amount of seed I put in the hopper barely filled it 1/4 the way, if that. Once about 2/3 the seed got dropped it seemed to wok OK at best. Seems to need a plate/grid between the hopper and auger to limit the weight on the moving parts. I'm afraid to try the Milo that I got it for. Can't recommend currently.
customer_reviews.author: /Dev/Null

customer_reviews.title: Parts on axle easily break so wont spread
customer_reviews.text: Only used a few times and wheels spin with out turning axle. So now it is useless. Edit: Forgot to update this. The process for a fix was relatively painless and simple. A new part was sent out and easy to install. It still shouldn't have happened with minimal use but my experience with warranty was good. Still works fine after a year of lawn and ice melt application. I did switch to a pellet type this year as opposed to small crystals.
customer_reviews.author: SwayingBacon

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and use.
customer_reviews.text: I have about 1200sq/ft of grass front and back. I used the hand grinder style spreaders in the past that were OK, but you have to refill a lot and drag the bag with you while using. This little giant I load up in the garage walk out to the front, spread (fertilizer) and then do the back in one shot.
customer_reviews.author: David J Martin

customer_reviews.title: Poor Design
customer_reviews.text: Holds a lot of product but the spreader wheel throws a lot of product against the wheels! This results in uneven distribution. Maybe if the wheels were a smaller diameter this wouldn't happen. I'm thinking about returning the spreader....
customer_reviews.author: Lindy58

customer_reviews.title: Plastic plates.
customer_reviews.text: no need to return (and stop complaining), just be creative.....party plastic on wheels before install. Over an out.
customer_reviews.author: Prem

customer_reviews.title: So Much Better than the Deluxe
customer_reviews.text: So far, very happy. I had a Deluxe for many years, and the part that spins the rotor started to fail. So I tossed it and debated buying another Deluxe or Elite. I bought the Elite and it is much better than the Deluxe. Better feel. Better wheels. Holds more. I'm definitely happy I spent up a little for the Elite and would recommend it over the Deluxe (which is also very good).
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: I usually don't write negative reviews but this one really ...
customer_reviews.text: I usually don't write negative reviews but this one really tipped me. I bought it two months ago, used it once, and on the second time I use it, I see that the lever no longer works at blocking the spread. Ugh.
customer_reviews.author: Yuval Tal

customer_reviews.title: Insure fasteners are tight
customer_reviews.text: Great much improved lawn spreader. Hopper will hold a full 25# bag of product. Unfortunately, during first application, one of the hopper fasteners lost the Acorn nuts.
customer_reviews.author: PENMEISTER

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend Scott’s DXL Broadcast Spreader
customer_reviews.text: Review for the DXL model: First use, 1 bag (40lbs), of dry pelletized lime, wheels would not turn. Pressure/weight of lime would not allow the spinner in the bottom of the bin to turn. To avoid breaking the gears I unloaded the bin to less than half full. Got wheels to turn, but now the over engineered slide in the bottom of the bin would only open 50% and would not close completely. I would not recommend the Scotts DXL Broadcast Spreader.
customer_reviews.author: MG2105

customer_reviews.title: Sub Par Quality
customer_reviews.text: Terrible. After pulling handle to start spreading, then release the handle to stop the release of material, It will not stop spreading because the fertilizer gets caught between the shute and spreader base. I called Scott’s about spreading rated for different products, but they had no answers unless it was in reference to “THEIR” products. Gave me some crap about a 20 by 50 rule. Sure, I’ll just waste money by experimenting with a expensive product to find the proper settings. We’re it not for the fact that I have already put on load of fertilizer through it, it would be going back. Absolutely hate it. No more Scott’s for me.
customer_reviews.author: BlueEagle

customer_reviews.title: Did an OK job but not great
customer_reviews.text: I used this with a 20lb bag of Scotts grass seed and it was a bit streaky. My house is on top of a hill so the lawn is slanted, maybe thats why? Not sure but it otherwise spread the seed as expected. I used it to overseed my lawn which is about a quarter-acre's worth. Not much to assemble, just had to slide the wheels on. For something you'll probably only used a handful of times per year it should hold up pretty well.
customer_reviews.author: AlRagusa

customer_reviews.title: Verdict is still out
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure if I'm doing something wrong or the issue is with this feeder but I get pretty inconsistent spreading. When I looked at the grass a few weeks after spreading, there were areas where I could see very green grass and streaks of yellow in between as if the fertilizer didn't get to the grass' roots in some places.Again, this could be my issue as I haven't done this before so it may be learning issue on my side. It hasn't broken down after a few uses so thats a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Gazi8

customer_reviews.title: Great for small yards
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice broadcaster for the money for small yards. I'm 6ft and the top handle was a little short for me but nothing that was a set back. I used this to spread fertilizer and weed control for about 6,000 Sq ft and maybe took me 20 min each. Only other complaint is the stand that helps it sit upright is really low to ground so if your going over any hilly areas it might drag a bit. This spreader got the job done and feels well built, should be able to get plenty of years out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Broadcast Lawn Spreader
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was very easy. This unit is built to last for a very long time. It is much easier to use than my previous Speedy Green spreader because the wheels/tires are larger and handle ground imperfections nicely. It's dispenser adjuster is high on the unit, easy to read and easy to adjust. I have only one regret, I wish I had bought it years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Allen L.

customer_reviews.title: This thing is big but not too big.
customer_reviews.text: Took less than 60 sec to unpack and install both wheels. Very sturdy, very nice. U can do everybody's lawn with this one! I used it last night, it spreads seed and or fertilizer very nice. I used it with that Black Beauty Grass Seed here on Amazon. It worked flawlessly. I couldn't get over the amount and pattern it was throwing. VERY NICE.. I saw a few neighbors watching, probably saying to themselves, I wish I had that. hahaha
customer_reviews.author: GZEUSJ

customer_reviews.title: Proper settings very hard to find making spreader less useful
customer_reviews.text: This is not a bad spreader. It's just completely unknown to just about every company making stuff to spread. Fertilizer, Seeds, Weed and Feed, it's hard to find anybody who's heard of this spreader and has the right settings for it. I wish Scotts would give us a conversion between this and one of their other models but we're out of luck. Their Spreader Settings tool doesn't have popular products like those sold at Menards. So while this spreader works just fine, it's not as useful as other, more well-known models.
customer_reviews.author: Kramnik

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made, fell apart within the first minute of use
customer_reviews.text: My experience with Scotts products has been good, but not with this one. On my first use I loaded 1/2 of a bag of lime in the hopper and might have made it 10 steps before the broadcaster sheared off and broke. Poor mostly plastic construction, don't bother with this one, buy something more substantial.
customer_reviews.author: bargainshopper

customer_reviews.title: Does not spread
customer_reviews.text: This "spreader" leaves dark green lines all over my yard, much like the reviewer photos. Since I'm past the return window I'm just going to have to macguyver some way to make it work. The wheel trick and possibly another piece of cardboard above the wheels to prevent too much fertilizer from falling between the wheels. Otherwise it's just $ down the drain.
customer_reviews.author: applecidered

customer_reviews.title: Very Poor build quality
customer_reviews.text: I'm very disappointed with the build quality. It broke literally with a minute. The spinning disk's neck broke after hardly been used. Would never recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: mimei

customer_reviews.title: Great little tool
customer_reviews.text: this was easy to setup with really no instructions needed. I have used this for my scott weed and feed as well as milorganite spread for 7,000 Sq ft lawn size. It works like a charm , especially the edge guard piece which makes sure, it spreads where its needed. Nothing specific to this tool, but make sure you dont try to use this on a wet lawn, else all your spread material will stick to it. Happy Spreading!!
customer_reviews.author: AmyJ

customer_reviews.title: Easier to push with a full hopper
customer_reviews.text: I pretty happy with the Elite’s better construction than the old Scotts Speedy-Green 3000 spreader. Easier to push with a full hopper on a 1/3 acre rough St Augustine yard in Spring TX, I credit the bigger foam filled rubber wheels, taller handle and better broadcast mechanism. I like the setting dial and positive response of the control levers. I wish the wheels were a little taller like the Earthway 2150 but I wasn’t willing to pay double the Elite price.
customer_reviews.author: Robert and Lori Westgard

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy and cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: For $35, I got a bunch of cheap plastic that may last 2 years if I'm lucky. Spreader could barely balance on level ground let along on uneven ground. There is a flimsy, cheap bar to keep the spreader from falling backwards. That should last a year before it rusts. This is a toy at best. Buy the next level higher. You're be happy you did!!
customer_reviews.author: Spence

customer_reviews.title: Great product if you want a striped lawn
customer_reviews.text: Huh... would have thought Scott's would have lawn spreader dialed... adding scotts fertilizer and setting dial was easy... turning off edge guard was easy... spreading was easy... the green lines that showed how unevenly the fertilizer spread are lame. If you want a zebra lawn this spreader is for you! Not impressed...
customer_reviews.author: Ian 2000

customer_reviews.title: Compact and easy to use, but not for left handed people
customer_reviews.text: I like it's compact in size. That means it is easy to store. Remember, this thing won't be used more than twice a week for about 6 months of the year. However, it is not designed for left handed people. You see, the lever to activate spreading is located closer to the right hand. Which means one has to akwardly hold the lever with the left hand to continue spreading stuff. That's an inconvenience at the least.
customer_reviews.author: Vinay

customer_reviews.title: lines in the yard.
customer_reviews.text: look at the others post about the lines it leave in the yard.(see others posting and pictures) Second spreading of top dressing seed dose the same as the fertilizer installed in the spring.Lines are center spreading. It works well showing your path and lines used. Don not try this unless there is some kind of fix.
customer_reviews.author: chuck Wagon

customer_reviews.title: "Edge feature" drops all the cast from the Right side in one line causing burn lines!
customer_reviews.text: Awful edging feature. It basically just dumps whatever would be cast over a couple feet straight down and then burns out the grass along every edge of your yard. Basically never use the edge guard and just stay far enough away from the plants you want to avoid.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Dawn Kallio

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Not too big, light and easy to use to spread seed. Depending on the size of your yard this may be a bit on the small size but it does hold a lot. This stores easily in a shed or your garage. Sturdy and can be maneuvered easily with no issues to clean out. I would definitely recommend if you are not looking for something big.
customer_reviews.author: XMC

customer_reviews.title: Works great with no issues.
customer_reviews.text: This was the same price as the big box stores when I purchased it but I didn't have to worry about some kid putting it together wrong or losing pieces. With that said the installation process was one of the easiest I have ever done. I would say anyone (literally anyone) could put this together and it's a quick install.
customer_reviews.author: Rocky Pittie

customer_reviews.title: Decent spreader so far but inconsistent results
customer_reviews.text: Have used it twice now. It is relatively light weight, mechanically it has performed OK. The plastic wheels are hollow which can catch some of what you are dispersing and cause some unevenness and mess, but not terrible. When they wear down I plan to replace with better quality rubber wheels. The instructions for the Scotts feed I used were to space the dispersal by about 6 ft, the result was very streaky lines of green grass. I'd say with the dispersal range of this spreader, more condensed paths are needed. I went back over the less green spots and will see how it turns out.
customer_reviews.author: Paul B. Throgmorton

customer_reviews.title: Poor design
customer_reviews.text: The assembled spreader wobbles when standing on a flat surface. The 2 screws that connect the handle protrude at both sides and could scratch someone who passes to the side of the spreader. The shutter got stuck due to solid granules in Scotts product causing fertilizer to keep spreading on my driveway. It was hard to dislodge.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Alien Crop Circles Explained!
customer_reviews.text: I have dark green lines about a foot wide streaking my lawn following the exact path of my new edgeguard spreader- I should have read the negative reviews on this product before buying it. The irony is that I was using Scotts fertilizer, and the edgeguard spreader was a replacement for a Scotts speedygreen spreader that had worn out. Bummer - buyer beware. I am now going to purchase a replacement spreader, and you can bet I'll be spending more on my new spreader than it costs me for a bag of fertilizer - get what you pay for, I guess.....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This works much better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: This works much better than I expected. It makes quick work of my lawn. Knocked off a star because you have to really hold down that lever and the spring is very strong, so it starts to hurt your hand a bit. Also, I pinched my hand under it the first time. Also, if you release and hold down the lever fairly often, and little door that goes up and down when you squeeze the lever can get stuck so you need to keep an eye on it. However, considering the price and comparing it to the handheld I had, this is great and I do my lawn really fast with minimal effort.
customer_reviews.author: Marko Jankovic

customer_reviews.title: Came in a box also, almost assembled. Just a few items to connect.
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd one I have had in life. Very light, easy to clean with the garden hose, hang it on the wall, 2 nails do it. It is plastic, don't put hard items in it, rock salt, big junk. Wears out the roller in the bottom. I did it. Did the metal one years ago, it rusted out. Very good delivery time. Perfect purchase.
customer_reviews.author: PC Scooter

customer_reviews.title: COMPLETE JUNK!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a complete piece of trash. It leaves green lines all over your yard where it over applies the fertilizer (even after you manufacture your own wheel covers), which is only good if you have giant checkers. Save your money and the headache AVOID AT ALL COST!!!!! It’s sitting in a pile of itself in my garage wasting space. It reminds me of the movie Elf when the children’s book was signed off missing pages. What a complete design FAILURE. JUNK!!!
customer_reviews.author: 🎢

customer_reviews.title: Broke in less then a year.
customer_reviews.text: This spreader would routinely drop more fertilizer in two rows because of the wheels. Besides that issue it seemed wo work ok, until the shift to the spinning disc snapped in half. I only had the spreader for a about 8 months and used it just a few times. Not very durable.
customer_reviews.author: AT

customer_reviews.title: Great spreader!
customer_reviews.text: I have gardened for 60 years. This is the best spreader I’ve owned. Lightweight. Love the edge feature!! That is fabulous. Intuitive buttons and features. Soooo easy to assemble (and to fold back again when I want to store in a compact way or load in my car to share with my son). Easy to rinse out (because it is lightweight and also because of the no-stock finish).
customer_reviews.author: NKL

customer_reviews.title: It’s not to good .. :(
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this but it really didn’t work to good. The wheel sticks and it doesn’t through anything evenly I actually have to push it a certain way to get to work properly. It’s plastic the wheels are flimsy I wouldn’t buy this product again. I would probably spend more and buy something reliable and that actually works correctly.
customer_reviews.author: J. Giron

customer_reviews.title: Far superior over a drop spreader.
customer_reviews.text: My drop spreader bit the bullet after 15 years so I bought this rotary spreader to replace it. The nice thing about the rotary vs the drop is you don't need to be so precise in your waking lines. And I can cover ground more quickly. Scott spreaders are always well built. Im pleased with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Michael O. Davis

customer_reviews.title: excellent,
customer_reviews.text: I had mini but broke after a year mild use. This is huge and very smooth, the other needed to push and was getting stuck on the grass, eventually the transmission plastic part connecting to it broke, could not be fixed. This is best and great price for $90 compared to other places.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Was cheaper than the big box stores
customer_reviews.text: my 20 year old spreader finally rusted through the frame and it was time to replace. Like the edgeguard feature but I can tell it is not built as well as my old one. I guess more profit from making them in china. hopefully it will last for 10 years and if it does not I will be looking for a commerical brand next.
customer_reviews.author: Florida Mariner

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm not really sure how I spread seed and fertilizer before I bought this but I’m guessing pretty in effectively. This thing is lightweight easy to assemble has the dial controls and is a great deal highly recommend this spreader
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Cecchetti

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I ordered
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for the 2000 Scotts drop spreader and appears to be a little more sturdier than the older model and comes with a soft foam grip on the handle. There was a small chunk of the foam torn out on the bottom of the handle (not sure if this was intentional or not), but it doesn't affect the functionality of the grip.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Agdinaoay

customer_reviews.title: $15 cheaper than at local hardware stores!
customer_reviews.text: This has been great for my new yard. AND it's $15 cheaper than at my local HD. It is ready to go out of the box, easy to operate and most top fertilizers have the exact number setting for this spreader in the instructions so it makes it very user friendly to start spreading. The Edge guard feature is also pretty cool! Saves a lot of wasted fertilizer and keeps clean up to a minimum.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel L

customer_reviews.title: Scotts Turf Builder EdgeGuard Deluxe Broadcast Spreader
customer_reviews.text: It's surprising how much difference a little soft rubber on the handle bar makes. The previous model I had did not have it. The Edge Guard feature, in my opinion, isn't worth the extra expense -- it still broadcasts whatever you're spreading, but not as far. As in my previous Scotts broacast spreader, except for the handle, screws and the rod for the wheels, it's all plastic. I hope this lasts longer.
customer_reviews.author: John_in_NC

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy.
customer_reviews.text: It worked one time. Now, for apparently no reason at all, the right wheel is almost impossible to rotate. This is the wheel the drives the spreader action, so it is completely useless. And since 30 days have elapsed since my first use, I can't return. $60 down the drain. Trust the negative reviews. It is junk. Just get a professional grade spreader.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Sheckells

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: This broadcast spreader works great. The Edge Guard does it job by not allowing the product being applied to be spread to the right side of the unit. If you're like me and have using a drop spreader for years it will take a little getting used to as the spread pattern of the broadcast spreader is about six feet wide when walking a a normal pace. Assembly couldn't be easier.
customer_reviews.author: DWM Jr

product_meta.title: Scotts Turf Builder EdgeGuard Mini Broadcast Spreader - Spreads Grass Seed, Fertilizer and Salt - Holds up to 5,000 sq. ft. of Scotts Grass Seed or Fertilizer Products
product_meta.description: Style:1. Mini| Pattern Name:SpreaderSpread grass seed and fertilizer products more efficiently and effectively with Scotts Turf Builder EdgeGuard Mini Broadcast Spreader. Equipped with Scotts exclusive EdgeGuard Technology to keep product off of your landscaping, driveways and sidewalks, you can trust that the product will be spread accurately. The control panel with precision rate settings delivers even more accurate coverage. The Scotts Turf Builder EdgeGuard Mini Spreader comes pre-calibrated and fully assembled with fold-down handle for easy storage. Can be used for salting.
feature_bullets: Scotts Turf Builder Mini walk-behind broadcast spreader features Scotts exclusive EdgeGuard Technology to keep product off landscaping, driveways, and sidewalks
Designed to deliver superior results when used with Scotts fertilizer and grass seed products; can be used for salting
Comes pre-calibrated and fully assembled with fold-down handle for easy storage
Ideal for treating smaller areas, and its compact design allows for easy storage
Holds up to 5,000 sq. ft. of Scotts lawn products
